definition: Zhao Ziyang (1919-2005), PRC reforming politician, general secretary of Chinese Communist Party 1987-1989, held under house arrest from 1989 to his death, and non-person since then
to surpass (old)
surname Zhao/one of the seven states during the Warring States Period (476-220 BC)/the Former Zhao 前趙 (304-329) and Later Zhao 後趙 (319-350), states of the Sixteen Kingdoms
purple/violet
positive (electric.)/sun/male principle (Taoism)/Yang, opposite: 陰|阴[yin1]
Hua Guofeng (1921-2008), leader of Chinese Communist Party after the Cultural Revolution
Deng Xiaoping (1904-1997), Chinese communist leader, de facto leader of PRC 1978-1990 and creator of "socialism with Chinese characteristics"
Hu Yaobang (1915-1989), Chinese politician
Yang Shangkun (1907-1998), former president of PRC and military leader
Jiang Zemin (1926-), politician, president of PRC 1993-2003
Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
Qiao Guanhua (1913-1973), PRC politician and diplomat
Li Xiannian (1909-1992), PRC general and politician
Li Fuchun (1900-1975), communist politician
Peng Zhen (1902-1997), Chinese communist leader
Zhu Rongji (1928-), PRC politician, premier 1998-2003
Zhou Enlai (1898-1976), Chinese communist leader, prime minister 1949-1976
Bo Yibo (1908-2007), ranking PRC politician, served on State Council from 1950s to 1980s as colleague of Deng Xiaoping
Song Renqiong (1909-2005), general of the People's Liberation Army
Dong Biwu (1886-1975), one of the founders of the Chinese communist party
Hu Jintao (1942-), General Secretary of the CCP 2002-2012, president of the PRC 2003-2013
